intro: Houstonia mullerae, commonly known as the Texas bluebell, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or open areas. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Houstonia mullerae plays an important role in pollination, attracting various insects such as bees and butterflies.
